description:
'''Stefan Đurić''' ({{lang-sr-Cyrl|Стефан Ђурић}}; born 16 November 1989), better known as '''Rasta''' ({{lang-sr-Cyrl|Раста}}), is a Serbian rapper, singer, songwriter and producer from [[Priština]]. Recognized as one of the most popular Serbian artists of his generation, Rasta is known for popularizing the [[Auto-Tune]] [[pitch correction]] effect in the [[Ex-Yu|western Balkans]] and for often promoting [[marijuana]] in his songs.

He has also written and produced songs for other prominent regional artists, including [[Boban Rajović]], [[Dara Bubamara]], [[Ana Stanić]], [[Sandra Afrika]], [[Elena Kitić]], [[Breskvica]], [[Nikolija (singer)|Nikolija]] and [[Teodora Džehverović]]. Đurić is the founder of the record label Balkaton Gang. In addition to music, Rasta starred as himself in the biographical film ''3211'' (2023).
